page.title: 11LANGUAGE : SWANSEA WEST
page.content: Most people in Killay and Sketty are monoglot, but a few are bilingual. My mother speaks Welsh and English. My grandpa spoke Welsh and English and so does mv Nan. When I go to the Comprehensive School, I want to take Welsh as a subject. The Headmaster of the Welsh School in Brynmill told us that out of 700 children in Killay, only 10 go to his school, which I think is a great shame. I was going to go to the Welsh School, but because my father cannot speak Welsh, I did not go. My mother was brought up in a very Welsh part of Dyfed. She spoke Welsh until she was 10, then she learnt English. My mother still speaks Welsh to her family. Because this is a University area, there are many students speaking languages other than English or Welsh ,e.g. Arabic,Chinese.
